info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 8:53PM MST until December 13 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD DEVELOPING BY TUESDAY MORNING... .A strong winter storm system will produce blizzard conditions over northeastern Colorado late tonight through Tuesday. Strong winds are expected to gust up to 60 mph. The heaviest snow is expected to be on the plains east of Greeley and Denver, focusing toward the Akron, Sterling, and possibly Fort Morgan areas. If you are planning travel north or east of Denver Tuesday, you should consider changing your plans to avoid travel. Travel will be difficult to impossible and road closures are likely. Those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare now for likely blizzard conditions on Tuesday. Continued cold and windy weather will continue behind the storm Wednesday and Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Fort Collins, Denver, Castle Rock, and Greeley. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility to a quarter mile or less. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.
